results.title: Out of the mouths of babes
results.creator_credit: Heather Cook and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Focuses on Peter and Jill de Villiers, two Harvard researchers, and their contention that knowledge of a language is innate in humans and develops as the child matures biologically. Includes interviews with both scientists and highlights their work. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.
results.description:

results.title: Freestyle nightclub
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dance Magic”.
Enjoy learning steps in the Nightclub Disco format. The figures may be danced to contemporary or Top 40 music in a variety of settings such as nightclubs, discos and parties.

results.title: The Joy of effort
results.creator_credit: Roman Bittman and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Shows how the adaptation of a scientific approach to different spheres of human movement is becoming increasingly important in improving performances. Shows testing and measuring different areas of fitness, for example a runner, skater, and a gymnast.

results.title: Sleep
results.creator_credit: Heather Cook and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
We spend a third of our lives asleep. This program looks at the structure of sleep and disturbances to that structure, such as nightmares and sleepwalking, sleep disorders such as narcolepsy and what happens when our normal daily patterns of sleep and wakefulness, day and night are interrupted.
results.description:

results.title: The Sexes: what's the difference?
results.creator_credit: Heather Cook, Roman Bittman and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Examines the question of whether or not there are certain basic biological differences between males and females. The assertion that the socialisation of children totally determines their social behaviour and attitudes is disputed. Environmental factors may not be the sole determinants of sex roles. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Heather Cook, Roman Bittman and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Roger Tory Peterson: portrait of a bird watcher
results.creator_credit: James Murray and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Roger Tory Peterson is a man of remarkable talents. A world-renowned naturalist and outstanding wildlife photographer, he is an artist whose wildlife paintings have been compared to those of the great Audubon. Throughout his distinguished career, Peterson has stuck to one principle in particular, the idea that knowledge about life will lead to a reverence for life. This video includes some of Peterson’s own spectacular footage from Antarctica, painting plates for a major revision for one of his field guides, bird watching in several locations, and talking about his love of birds. Presented by David Suzuki.

results.title: Aircraft; Jellyfish of the sky
results.creator_credit: Richard Longley and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Aircraft traces the history, sociology and technology of aircraft from the first flight of the Wright Brothers in 1903, the “barnstorming” era, the coming of the first airlines, the transformation of combat in two world wars to highly computerised airlines and jet-fighters. “Jellyfish of the sky” also known as balloons and airships, were the first flying machines. In 1783, the first hot air balloon was flown. Two weeks later, the hydrogen balloon took to the air. This program explains the importance of these events.

results.title: A Pain in the back
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
A documentary about the causes of back pain in humans and the ways that different people cope with it. The methods, used for the treatment of back pain, that are looked at in the program are exercise, acupuncture and surgical intervention.
results.description:
